body_html:
Hi @bioothod, for your unit test, you can just check the device of the imported nodes, without actually running them. To access the device of a node, use Node.requested_device. To access the imported Nodes, use return_nodes.

I believe Asim is referring to his comment from Aug 16.
body_text:
Hi @bioothod, for your unit test, you can just check the device of the imported nodes, without actually running them. To access the device of a node, use Node.requested_device. To access the imported Nodes, use return_nodes.
I believe Asim is referring to his comment from Aug 16.
body:
Hi @bioothod, for your unit test, you can just check the device of the imported nodes, without actually running them. To access the device of a node, use [Node.requested_device](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/903a6399aab19b549fefd0ead836af644f3d00f8/tensorflow/core/graph/graph.h#L102). To access the imported Nodes, use [return_nodes](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/903a6399aab19b549fefd0ead836af644f3d00f8/tensorflow/core/graph/graph_constructor.h#L129).

I believe Asim is referring to his comment from Aug 16.
